sentences.english: I got a splinter in my finger while I was moving the boxes.
sentences.chinese: 我在搬箱子的時候手指頭上紮了一根刺。

sentences.english: Moment such as sting, tight at mind, again difficult pull out.
sentences.chinese: 瞬間如刺，紮在了心上，再難拔除。

sentences.english: Applying needles at pressure points is thought to trigger electrical pulses that suppress appetite.
sentences.chinese: 將細針紮在壓力穴可以誘發抑制食慾的神經電脈衝。

sentences.english: Adjustable gastric banding is the second most popular form of bariatric surgery.
sentences.chinese: 可調節胃紮帶手術是第二受歡迎的減肥手術。

sentences.english: Send you a firm white lily, good and it.
sentences.chinese: 送你一紮白合花，百年好和指望它。

sentences.english: Okay, I've decided to have a jug of Asahi dry.
sentences.chinese: 好，我決定要一紮舒波樂乾啤。

sentences.english: She had her ears pierced so that she could wear ear-rings.
sentences.chinese: 她已紮了耳朵眼好戴耳環。

sentences.english: Nothing was stolen, but now a family of birds is living somewhere in my house.
sentences.chinese: 東西倒是一樣沒少，就是有一家子鳥飛進來紮了窩。

sentences.english: His finger was spitted a thorn.
The knife stuck in the ground at his feet.
sentences.chinese: 刀紮在了他腳邊的地上。

sentences.english: Needles need to go into specific points in the body.
sentences.chinese: 針必須紮在身體的一些特定穴位上。

sentences.english: Sun Fei-hu gave orders to his men to retreat to the distance required and pitch tents there.
sentences.chinese: 一面孫飛虎傳令賊衆後退一箭之地，紮下營帳。

sentences.english: Can also tie the bundles of lavender, the card is inserted in the above table.
sentences.chinese: 也可以紮上幾束薰衣草，將桌卡插在花束上面。

sentences.english: Put out some overripe bananas with a few holes on a platform above head level.
sentences.chinese: 在比人頭高的平臺上放些紮了洞的過熟香蕉。

sentences.english: At night Lucy started to GO through the bundle of letters that she received in the day.
sentences.chinese: 晚上，露茜開始看她白天收到的一紮信件。

sentences.english: Don't wrap gift money in white , blue or black paper .
sentences.chinese: 別用白，藍，黑這三種顏色的紙包紮錢。

definition: to tie/bind or fasten together/to kidnap
to draw towards oneself/to gather/to gather up (one's gown, sleeves etc)/to grab (money)/to extort
to hug/to embrace/to hold in one's arms
to block sb's path/to obstruct/to flag down (a taxi)
